moves.1... e5 2. dxe5 d6: i do something called the englund gambit but my variation couldn't be foun in the gameknot openings section sadly
moves.4... Bxd6 5. e3 a6 6. Bd2 Nc6 7. Be2 Bb4: tries to threaten my pawn on b7
moves.12... c6: not only does this move block the bishop but it also lets me develop my queen to c7
moves.13. Re1+ Kd7: i move my king so that i don't have to block and get that piece pinned for a while
moves.15. Kxh2 Ng4+: this is a very good move because if he takes, i get a free move and its somewhat a discovered aattck
moves.16. Bxg4 hxg4+: i check again to open up an entire file for my rook for free
moves.18. Qb3 Qh4: i think i can take a hit or two all my good pieces are linked up and i think its somewhat a deadmate because kf1, bd3+, re2, qh1#
moves.22... Qh1#: i beat him because he was deadmated and its also because of the blunder he made ,though he put up a great fight . feel free to give me tips on my next annotation and comment

gameName: what it takes to win a gm in chess
